 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְבֵנָה‎</span> **noun feminine** ==brick, tile== (Late Hebrew ***id.***; Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎לְּבִינְתָּא‎</span> <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; Zinjirli <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לבן‎</span> (?) [[BDB#DHM|DHM]]<sup>Sendsch.37. 59</sup>; Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***libittu;***</u></abbr> Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> (loan-words according to [[BDB#Frä|Frä]]<sup>4f.</sup>); according to [[BDB#Thes|Thes]] and most from ***whiteness*** of clay, or light colour of sun-baked bricks; so [[BDB#Nö|Nö]]<sup>ZMG xi,1886,735</sup> [[BDB#Lag|Lag]]<sup>BN 139</sup>; &gt; others regard as Assyrian loan-word [[BDB#VOJ|VOJ]]<sup>i. 22ff.</sup>; in Assyrian a derivative from <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***labânu***</u></abbr>, ***throw down, prostrate***, is sought [[BDB#Dl|Dl]]<sup>Pr. 93f.(compare HWB 369)</sup>); — <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ל‎</span> [[Gen.11.3|Gen 11:3]]; [[Ezek.4.1|Ezek 4:1]] construct <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לִבְנַת‎</span> [[Exod.24.10|Exod 24:10]] plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְבֵנִים‎</span> [[Gen.11.3|Gen 11:3]] + 7 t.; suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִלִּבְנֵיכֶם‎</span> [[Exod.5.19|Exod 5:19]] — 

**1.** brick, as building-material, [[Gen.11.3|Gen 11:3]] (singular collective; elsewhere plural) v[[Gen.11.3|Gen 11:3]]; [[Exod.1.14|Exod 1:14]] straw used in making [[Exod.5.7|Exod 5:7]], compare v[[Exod.5.8|Exod 5:8]] v[[Exod.5.16|Exod 5:16]] v[[Exod.5.18|Exod 5:18]] v[[Exod.5.19|Exod 5:19]]; [[Isa.9.9|Isa 9:9]] (figurative; as inferior to <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎גָּזִית‎</span> ***hewn stone***); incense burnt on [[Isa.65.3|Isa 65:3]] ( = roof-tiles ? compare [[BDB#Che|Che]] [[BDB#Di|Di]]). 

**2.** = ***tile***, on which plan of city could be engraved (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חקק‎</span>) [[Ezek.4.1|Ezek 4:1]]. 

**3.** = ***pavement***, [[Exod.24.10|Exod 24:10]] (compare [[BDB#Di|Di]]).
